entry.message: [info] Activation of plug-in DQC Rules Validator successful, version Check version using Tools->DQC->Version on the GUI or --dqc-version on the command line. - validate/DQC
[info] Activation of plug-in SEC Inline Transforms successful, version 19.2. - EDGAR/transform

[DQC.US.0043.6833] The concept PaymentToFoundingMembersUnderTheTaxReceivableAgreement is included in the calculation of NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations. This is in the role 0000011 - Statement - CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS OF CASH FLOWS. PaymentToFoundingMembersUnderTheTaxReceivableAgreement is a credit balance type concept representing a natural cash outflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations. A credit balance type concept should always be assigned a negative one (-1) calculation weight as it is a deduction from net income (loss) to reconcile to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations. PaymentToFoundingMembersUnderTheTaxReceivableAgreement has been incorrectly provided a positive one (+1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy. Correct the calculation weight to negative one (-1) and input the value as a positive amount if it is a deduction of a non-cash income or gain, an increase in an asset, or a decrease in a liability. If the value is an add-back of a non-cash expense or loss, decrease in an asset, or an increase in a liability and PaymentToFoundingMembersUnderTheTaxReceivableAgreement is the correct concept, input a negative value.
Rule Element Id:6833 Rule version: 26.0.9 - ncmi-20231228.htm 8

property.name: label
property.value: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activities, Continuing Operations

entry.message:
[DQC.US.0043.6833] The concept IncreaseDecreaseInOtherOperatingCapitalNet is included in the calculation of NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations. This is in the role 0000011 - Statement - CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS OF CASH FLOWS. IncreaseDecreaseInOtherOperatingCapitalNet is a credit balance type concept representing a natural cash outflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations. A credit balance type concept should always be assigned a negative one (-1) calculation weight as it is a deduction from net income (loss) to reconcile to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations. IncreaseDecreaseInOtherOperatingCapitalNet has been incorrectly provided a positive one (+1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy. Correct the calculation weight to negative one (-1) and input the value as a positive amount if it is a deduction of a non-cash income or gain, an increase in an asset, or a decrease in a liability. If the value is an add-back of a non-cash expense or loss, decrease in an asset, or an increase in a liability and IncreaseDecreaseInOtherOperatingCapitalNet is the correct concept, input a negative value.
Rule Element Id:6833 Rule version: 26.0.9 - ncmi-20231228.htm 8

property.name: label
property.value: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activities, Continuing Operations
